pr_title: add @GeneratedValue annotation that can be used to autogenerate Id value on insert

timeline.message: add @GeneratedValue annotation that can be used to autogenerate Id value on insert
fix style issues in integration test

timeline.bodyText:
I remember we had an issue with UUID generation in activityId causing long pauses due to lack of real randomness entropy.
Do other spring plugin use auto generated UUID? I wonder if we should use fast uuid generation for this (similar to activityId in the SDK)
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: @moderakh - can you please point to the code where we auto generate activity id in the SDK code, may be we can implement something similar in spring if it helps with the performance.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

replies.bodyText:
Thanks for the code @moderakh , however the above TimeBasedUUIDGenerator is being brought in by uuid external dependency which is currently in the banned dependency list.
I also checked our V2 async code, and we use the randomUUID generator to generate UUIDs.
In my opinion, it is not worth going through internal shading process for this. What are your thoughts?
replies.author: kushagraThapar
moderakh

timeline.bodyText: what happens if a field of non String type is annotated with @ GeneratedValue do we support that? or do we error out?
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: We error it out that @GeneratedValue can only be used on a string id.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.bodyText: Please add Microsoft headers to this file.
timeline.author: kushagraThapar
